metadata.Title: CVE-2017-6353 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
net/sctp/socket.c in the Linux kernel through 4.10.1 does not properlyrestrict association peel-off operations during certain wait states, whichallows local users to cause a denial of service (invalid unlock and doublefree) via a multithreaded application.  NOTE: this vulnerability existsbecause of an incorrect fix for CVE-2017-5986.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6353` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.13.0-117.164
linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-117.164
linux-image-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.13.0-117.164
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-117.164
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-117.164
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-117.164
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-117.164
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-117.164
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.13.0-117.164
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.13.0-117.164
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-75.96~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-75.96~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-75.96~14.04.1

linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-75.96~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-75.96~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-75.96~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-75.96~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-75.96~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
